instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02
threads.message:
hi guys I have a MacBook air board , with water damage after ultrasonic , I did the rail tests and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> was with short to ground I inyect voltage on the line and nothing got hot , then I remove <RESISTOR>R5450</RESISTOR> and the short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> gone , but , still <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> was with short I apply voltage to that line now and nothing got hot , after removing components 1 by 1 : <TRANSISTOR>Q7310</TRANSISTOR> was shorting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> to ground , I replace it , and I try to power on , nothing , now here is what I currently have on my board:

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> : IS PRESENT
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> :PRESENT
GREEN LIGHT : YES
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>: PRESENT
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>: PRESENT
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>: PRESENT

What rails I should see now?

S0 rails : Not present
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>: not present I read on <RESISTOR>R8178</RESISTOR> 0v Next step?

ORIGINAL WATER DAMAGE:

<CHIP>U7200</CHIP>
<CHIP>U5620</CHIP>
<CHIP>U7310</CHIP>
<CHIP>U7840</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q7310</TRANSISTOR> was shorted so full PPBUS voltage came on to the CPU. I bet the CPU Vcore is shorted, so dead CPU. The end.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02
threads.message: well ..... i guess the only thing left to do is to write DAMN!
